meanings.definition: A person who assesses or makes changes to something to make it fit better or function properly.
meanings.sent1: The adjustors came to our house to fix the broken door.
meanings.sent2: The adjustors at the furniture store helped me find the right chair height.
meanings.sent3: The adjustors tried to make the wobbly table stand on one leg - it was quite a sight!
meanings.sent4: Her words were like adjustors, fine-tuning my emotions to a harmonious melody.
meanings.sent5: The adjustors meticulously adjusted each screw until the machine ran smoothly.

meanings.definition: A device or tool used to make small changes or corrections.
meanings.sent1: I used the adjustors on the telescope to focus on the stars.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic used the adjustors to fix the alignment of the car's wheels.
meanings.sent3: The adjustors in the toolbox were like tiny wizards fixing everything they touched.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were like adjustors, zooming in on the smallest details of the painting.
meanings.sent5: With the adjustors, the artist could fine-tune the colors of the masterpiece.

meanings.definition: An insurance professional who investigates and settles claims.
meanings.sent1: The adjustors from the insurance company arrived to assess the damage.
meanings.sent2: The adjustors carefully reviewed the policy to determine coverage.
meanings.sent3: The adjustors joked that they were like detectives solving the case of the missing car.
meanings.sent4: Her mind worked like adjustors, swiftly analyzing the facts to reach a conclusion.
meanings.sent5: The adjustors negotiated skillfully to settle the claim fairly for both parties.
